column4: 7.04 feisty fawn runs beautifully on my laptop; however, the touch pad does not work.
I see ubuntu still hasn't fixed the synaptics touchpad problems
I see ubuntu still hasn't fixed the synaptics touchpad problems
have you submitted a bug report?
my touchpad works fine in windows, gparted live cd, partition magic boot disk, etc.. so its not my laptop its ubuntu.
I sugested you open a bug report. I didn't blame anything
its not a bug its some sorta configuration problem, but anyways, I already did submit the problem to ubuntu.
that is what a bug is, why did you say i was "blaming your system"?
so the bug is with the program that incorrectly configured that file. == bug
i'm sorry but you just do not know what you are talking about, configuration files are not programs, software.
ok mate, you are right. well done
Most bugs arise from mistakes and errors made by people in either a program's source code or its design, and a few are caused by compilers producing incorrect code.
